snippet: The head of a conservative national Lutheran denomination had criticized the Rev. Rob Morris, a pastor in Newtown, Conn., for taking part in an interfaith memorial service.
abstract: Lutheran Rev Matthew C Harrison apologizes to Rev Rob Morris, pastor in Newtown, Conn, after criticizing him for taking part in interfaith memorial service; Harrison's more conservative Lutheran Church-Missouri Synod bars joint worship out of concern that such services could lend credence to faiths it views as false.
lead_paragraph: The head of a conservative national Lutheran denomination had criticized the Rev. Rob Morris, a pastor in Newtown, Conn., for taking part in an interfaith memorial service.

headline.seo: Rev. Matthew C. Harrison Offers Apology for His Rebuke of Newtown Pastor
headline.main: After Rebuke, an Apology for Pastor in Newtown
headline.print_headline: Lutheran Leader Apologizes To Rebuked Newtown Pastor
